Looking forward for your response.

Best regards,

certificate on the Mac machine, but the DPI shows that the certificate is
not trusted. As a result, we have disabled DPI on the dashboard. Ideally,
it should show as trusted.

TextBody:
Hello Ramesh,

Thank you for getting back to us.

After you download and drag the certificate to your system, you will have to click on it and on the Trust option select always trust. 
In this way the certificate will become trusted and the DPI will work.

Could you please check and let us know the outcome? 

Looking forward for your response.

Best regards,
__________________
Daniel Anton | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | MDM | Device Control | Content Aware Protection
www.endpointprotector.com

daniel.anton@endpointprotector.com

TextBody:
Hello,

Did you receive the previous email form my colleague?

"Hello Ramesh,

Thank you for getting back to us.

After you download and drag the certificate to your system, you will have to click on it and on the Trust option select always trust. 
In this way the certificate will become trusted and the DPI will work.

Could you please check and let us know the outcome? 

Looking forward for your response.

Best regards,
